intro: Schiedeella dodii, commonly known as the Dod's schiedea, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Schiedeella dodii is known for its unique morphology and is considered a rare species due to habitat loss and limited distribution. Its ecological significance lies in its role as a food source for native insects and its contribution to the biodiversity of Hawaiian ecosystems.
